member.name: SIGDN
member.summary: Requests the form of an item's display name to retrieve through and .

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_NORMALDISPLAY
member.summary: 0x00000000. Returns the display name relative to the parent folder. In UI this name is generally ideal for display to the user.

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVEPARSING
member.summary: (int)0x80018001. Returns the parsing name relative to the parent folder. This name is not suitable for use in UI.

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_DESKTOPABSOLUTEPARSING
member.summary: (int)0x80028000. Returns the parsing name relative to the desktop. This name is not suitable for use in UI.

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVEEDITING
member.summary: (int)0x80031001. Returns the editing name relative to the parent folder. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_DESKTOPABSOLUTEEDITING
member.summary: (int)0x8004c000. Returns the editing name relative to the desktop. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_FILESYSPATH
member.summary: (int)0x80058000. Returns the item's file system path, if it has one. Only items that report SFGAO_FILESYSTEM have a file system path. When an item does not have a file system path, a call to on that item will fail. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user in some cases, but note that it might not be specified for all items.

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_URL
member.summary: (int)0x80068000. Returns the item's URL, if it has one. Some items do not have a URL, and in those cases a call to will fail. This name is suitable for display to the user in some cases, but note that it might not be specified for all items.

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVEFORADDRESSBAR
member.summary: (int)0x8007c001. Returns the path relative to the parent folder in a friendly format as displayed in an address bar. This name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVE
member.summary: (int)0x80080001. Returns the path relative to the parent folder.
